config.question: How did Hoover deal with the Bonus Army when they marched on Washington in 1932?

choices.content: He gave the Bonus Army the federal assistance they were demanding.
He ignored the situation after the Bonus Army arrived in Washington.
He had General MacArthur and the regular army forcibly disperse the Bonus Army.
He immediately drafted Bonus Army marchers into the regular army.

answer_2.response: Consider This: In June 1932, a group of 20,000 World War I veterans marched on Washington, D.C., to demand immediate payment of their “adjusted compensation” bonuses voted by Congress in 1924. Congress rejected their demands. See L.O. 26.2 Fighting the Depression.
